bMThIWieooGy5DZmHDMORg.text: Good greasy spoon.  Quick and Cheap breakfast even on the weekends.  Don't expect anything fancy, but for the price and the fact that it's walking distance, it's hard to beat.

iNqCwZ7UEhdMfrojHw25XQ.text: I say 3.5 for good measure. It's definitely the best bang for your buck in the neighborhood. Simple place, simple interior, simple service, simple deli/diner type menu. The $3.99 breakfast cannot be beat. Have had lunch a couple times, tried the chicken pita on the first go round; which was great, and the corned beef Reuben with potato salad on the second. I enjoy a Reuben with soft thick rye like the kind they use here, but I wouldn't say it tasted like an authentic "NY deli reuben".  Potato salad was quite tastey, you can tell its made in house and not from a tub. Yellow based, and tangy as expected.   The best part- one of the cooks is a Deadhead, so if youre a fan too, the conversation can be quite entertaining :)

wH9IcjMnUn-OsHmUkrlyEg.text: I eat here about 4 times a week, so I must like it.  Great sandwiches. Best fried okra around!  Always hot and delicious.  I'm a salad lover and their side salad is always fresh and delicious - with cucumbers, red onion and tomato.  The staff is so friendly and on the ball.  Truly a neighborhood institution.

EOrZtn93XQA7-Djf6SkW_g.text: GROSS...... guy in the kitchen rubbing the underside of his nose with his hand and going back to preparing food.  No one in the kitchen wears a hat and they scratch their heads in the kitchen area.  All this and never go to wash there hands.  It might be cheap but the doctors bills will not be, if you can see this, imagine what you can not see....Diner Beware

eKyanBMjDqoAc1LVPj68EQ.text: Sammy's Deli looks like a simple, unassuming burger joint more than a deli. It's the kind of place that you drive by a few times, look at the quaint exterior and sign and pass because you already know of a great burger place that you can count on.   One rainy day while I got my oil changed at nearby Meineke, I decided to give Sammy's a try.  The menu is reasonably priced, ranging from your typical burgers, sandwiches and salads from basic to the ones with lots of fixin's.   The interior isn't very notable. Order up at the register, walk by their open kitchen, and take a seat at one of the vinyl booths with a formica table.   Los Angeles would snap up this authentic old cafe style restaurant and throw in some new modern light fixtures, fill in a cool color scheme to make it less sterile, and hire lots of hot waiters and waitresses. But, Sammy's keeps it real. What you see is what you get, no pretension. It was busy, but no long lines, just a few tables of fireman and local folks.   My cheeseburger was surprisingly pretty good. Well-cooked, well-seasoned, a soft bun and pretty satisfying. Fries were also good. One of the cook's (possibly an owner) came out and asked how we liked things. He was very friendly and not overbearing. We traded tips on nixing computer viruses and spyware.  Sammy's food is solid and is a good alternative to the beaten path joints.

V1N2u5lZc7VXMO_iG6Rx_A.text: The food is excellent and the staff is very friendly. The fact that they don't serve their food on fancy plates and keep it simple adds to the enjoyment. This place lets their food do all the talking! Breakfast and lunch are bother delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Sammy's Deli Restaurants - Charlotte, NC, United States. Philly cheesesteak!

MkN5AMUYx1Q4ZTfxYswGRQ.text: Still a fan.  They are back in my high esteem.  The welcome of the staff is unwavering.  If you have no joy when you enter, you leave with some.  You don't have to be a regular to feel comfortable.  I had one of the breakfast specials.  I briefly considered the pork chop special that I saw was back on the board but it is HUGE.  I was not up to the challenge today.  Service was quick and super friendly.  Food was hot and portions generous.  When food is simple, execution is what elevates it.  That's what you get here.  I'll take performance over pretense any day.

Xc69HjIswZJwrwB5rbiRKw.text: Nothing fancy, just some solid diner food. My corned beef hash breakfast vanquished my hangover pretty decisively.

dVQZd1BuPgQMJTApGTcSMQ.text: Heard really great things and live in the neighborhood so decided to give it a try, walked in and was almost shocked as someone who works in restaurants by how unfriendly and unwelcoming the woman at the counter was. She made it blatantly clear she did not want to be there and was extremely rude. After we ordered and sat down there was another man who was waiting on a togo order she almost physically pushed him out of her way and basically screamed "EXCUSE ME" to him. Shocking. The food portions were huge, and everyone else on staff was friendly and helpful. The food was nothing impressive in my opinion, but I think the single actions of the hateful counter girl really guaranteed we would not be bringing our business back here. As someone who lives so close and is a big supporter of local business it's a real disappointment to cross this place off our list.

o_f3OQNGW46PL3aho9EI_A.text: 5 star cheap breakfast!! I give it 5 stars because going in I know what I am getting.   This a 2 egg, meat, grits/hashbrowns, toast/biscuit type of place.  Yes sure they have pancakes and french toast but most of the people are eating the $3.99 special.  I eat here quite frequently because it is cheap, convenient, and it taste good!  Oh and when you come, if you are getting a tea or coke then you can bring your own cup because they give you a small styro cup that just gets your mouth wet... not quench your thirst.

jIMbRq7ZwuwTysHN1UGbrg.text: What did the mop say to the floor?  Nothin'...  They've never met.  I dont think I have ever eaten in a dirtier establishment.  I'm not talking about a day old mess more like months of dirt on the dining area floor...  Balled up napkins and old french fries.  But I did stay and ordered the Philly Cheesesteak with fries.  $7.10 with water...  The sandwich was good but nothing spectactular.  The fries were fresh and hot.  If I go back it will be for breakfast most likely.

Thrz1iCb93lMYlA2i4dYUw.text: Where can you get breakfast for 4 bucks, shredded 'tater hash browns, biscuits the size of your head, and fried pickles at half the price of the Penguin? Sammy's, of course!  You order coffee here and it comes in a pint sized styro-cup. None of this "what size do you want" crap.  Waitstaff is predictably bored but able.    This is not quality food - I'd put it a step up from Waffle House, if I had to pin it down. But it's filling, super cheap, and tasty. Portions are HUGE. And most of their veggies are meat-free, so you can grab a veg plate if they're through serving brekkie.

kvjjBwXXrb8IclCWBPlypw.text: Not the most beautiful, but it is a great place for a quick yummy and affordable breakfast.

OwmlkXvUPGrQ6s70GivqMQ.text: Welp,I finally tried this place,and I loved it....friendly people and great prices.I got the spicy chicken pita which was really good.The chicken was cooked right and was chopped to where you could eat bite by bite.I will def. be going here on a new regular basis

MRjjsu_9k_imBIZWM-7EgA.text: I have been a patron here since day one in the late 1990's when Sam Balatsias snared this location and put his vision to work. With help from his mother & Father, (Maria & Dionysius) & his sisters, Sammy implemented business savvy and proper pricing along w/ his winning personality to put Sammy's Deli on the map of any Plaza/Midwood resident. To update other posts, all the booth seats and chairs are new and the guys work hard to ensure consistancy. All the other reviews declared surprising satisfaction w/ quality and portion for the speed and low price one seeks on a working weekday. Open Monday through Saturday 6 a.m. - 3 p.m.

photos.caption: Photo of Sammy's Deli Restaurants - Charlotte, NC, United States. Billy (Owner) workin&#39; hard on my S&#39;getti Parm.

ZrhDQEJlsPEiSAmU6KUz4w.text: What you see is what you get. Looks kind of like a dirty little place to grab a bite to eat and that's what it is. We were drawn in by the $3.45 +tax for eggs, bacon, hash brown, and a biscuit.   eggs - made like an omelet without any other ingredients, not bad though bacon - cooked nicely, tasted good, generous portion for the price hash brown - tops were cooked nice and crisp, but underneath was a bit of a greasy mess, biscuit - pretty good, large biscuit.  i doubt you will find more for your money than we got here. However, if you or someone in your party is a sanitation freak, wear a blindfold or avoid this place. (90% score) The seats were a little torn, stains on the ceiling, someone was smoking. Otherwise, tabletops and floor seemed clean, just an older establishment i guess.  We both just drank water, but two big, filling breakfast meals for under 9 bucks works for me. Overall, a greasy little meal  served on paper plates. Well worth the cost.

_H6ioCmtVKEWfwaQHKRsCw.text: Great place for Breakfast!  Really like the fact that they have Livermush on the menu..  Not very many places that have it around here.  The place has that "dive" atmosphere which I really like.  It brings back memories of the dives in the small town where I grew up.  Super Friendly service, great food, good prices.....what more can I say!?!

imGsntbLgktfa9lZCaBDQQ.text: hung over?  Best greasy breakfast in town!  In the mood for a cheap bbq plate with the biggest helping of potato salad and hush puppies?  DONE!  I have literally gone to this place in my pajamas.  If you are on a diet, I wouldn't bother coming here, but if your belly is in the mood for some good cheap eats, sammy's is the place to be.  My favorite so far is the Philly cheese steak sandwich mmmm.  I don't like reubins in general but my boyfriend always orders it.

0ovIAQpm3N5biVQS68e_BA.text: I'm all about an economical, hearty breakfast and man, was I satisfied.  After waiting unsuccessfully at John's around the corner, I decided to try Sammy's Deli with a friend.  We walked in, the cashier, took our order immediately, and were brought heaping portions of breakfast in 5 minutes or so.  Fair enough.  For $3.50, I got 2 eggs, sausage, a biscuit, and hashbrowns! The eggs were fluffy, the sausage not too greasy, and the hashbrowns cooked Waffle House style, mmm hmm.The coffee was served in 20 ounce styrofoam cup and surprisingly did not taste like the sludge served at gas stations.  The menu seemed to be pretty non-descript and most folks gravitated towards the breakfast special.  Granted, the place is a bit dingy.  Or "dive-ey" as they say in Plaza-Midwood, But the friendly, "What can I get you, hon?" cashier and the tasty food makes up for it.  If you like greasy, unpretentious breakfast fare and don't mind being served on Styrofoam plates, you're in for a treat!

fMgRDxD1lEvTPXffekwlBA.text: Good breakfast selection at a great price. The staff is very friendly and makes it worth eating in

2AYjNKWIkVc-1WkZdZlBAA.text: Nothing fancy, just great food and a great deal. This place is what Plaza Midwood is all about, right down to the friendly conversation from the staff. I've been here like 5 times over the past few months and have always had a great meal - from the lunch menu to the breakfast.

jLrgkR75fNav9xwM1Eplow.text: Good good food good prices good grief why wouldn't you come here Sammy's deli is the place to go breakfast is awesome

photos.caption: Photo of Sammy's Deli Restaurants - Charlotte, NC, United States. Where the magic happens
Photo of Sammy's Deli Restaurants - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Sammy's Deli Restaurants - Charlotte, NC, United States. Great place for breakfast ! Easy in easy out! Food is good and price is right

DfQF_2Wgx1o62eOOFq6ugQ.text: No frills place. Low prices. Bathroom needs cleaning.  Current grade 90.0. Has a tv. Lots of parking. Plastic utensils and plates. Drinks self serve. Lots of food specials. Friendly staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Sammy's Deli Restaurants - Charlotte, NC, United States. Flounder with grits eggs and toast. French toast with turkey sausage and eggs.

-d_yj3KPGsZXM5OHLID33w.text: Cool place. Very local feel. Good food better than Waffle House. Great prices. Just a local diner nothing fancy. Nothing bad

7yW432kGjkDGPo64VKFv6g.text: Sammy's is great because they serve solid breakfasts and great afternoon sandwiches, all at really good prices.  Their eggs, sausage, and biscuits are my favorites, and they have some of the best pancakes around.  The people there are fantastic, too.  I recently needed eggs for a huge crowd, and they took care of me that morning, and were extremely nice about it!  I try to go more regularly now, since I really value what they are doing in the neighborhood and the food is really good!

6N7RubivIHgWs4Pg5ZKb0w.text: Quick decent affordable food. Plenty of seating and parking. Nothing fancy but that's what I like about it. Not a health conscience or green place, but you're not paying for that here.

INDsWBCqwlaG9JM9GTfUPA.text: My go to breakfast place. I live about a mile away. I can place a to go order, walk out the door and it's ready when I get there (every time) . Owner and staff are always friendly. Best part, you get a great meal for a very reasonable price

z_Gl5bCD5xiAV5yMyi1VJg.text: I don't understand this place. This is a horrible representation of a deli. I'm all about a dive as long as the food is good, but this place is awful. The location is good, but the atmosphere is cold, dingy kind of like eating in a waiting room for a government agency. I don't  like when restaurants use Styrofoam plates and plastic cutlery. If an owner can't invest in some plates, why should I spend my money there?   My coffee was weak and bitter, the eggs and toast were cold and tasteless and the cheese grits tasted like foam with a slice of Kraft thrown on top. I really don't like giving poor reviews but  the only redeeming quality was that the staff was friendly. If you're drunk and or hung over this place may fit your bill, other than that, don't waste your time.

1fCcouY4ZZzvoD0bLl7MfQ.text: Good food & reasonable prices. I usually go to pick up a to go order for lunch on Saturdays if I'm around. The breakfast is pretty good My favorite is the steak sub (not the Philly). I usually get this, it's definitely one of the best I've had.

A2WY7fr3SZZE_VfoSLuVXA.text: Sammy's is a great neighborhood Deli that serves all of the hot food that Plaza-Midwood would need. From their incredible breakfasts (even better when hungover) to their savory lunch entrees, Sammy's really knows how to pull it together.  My personal favorites: Breakfast - Western Omelette or the biscuit sandwich (with sausage, obviously) Lunch - Gyro Plate, Triple-Decker Club, or patty melt (when was the last time you had a patty melt)?  This is loved by all sorts of locals. Don't let it's exterior fool you, the food is just what you would be looking for from a local "greasy spoon".

CPh3OUaL0FCKYfbmEDZ1Gg.text: Okay so two bad things about this place  1. they don't use actual dishes they use styrofoam and plastic 2. they need to mop the floors it that looks kind of dingy but that could just be from an old floor that needs a good power wash  This place is great to go to for a cheap good breakfast but after that it's just kind of Meh. If it wasn't for the servers and the service in this place I would never go back. The waitresses there are cute and friendly and make sure that you're taken care of even if your having a rough day

j08VWZnPYsCxOSQvTsJPHw.text: My go to spot in plaza midwood.  EXTREMELY cheap breakfast specials and reasonable lunch deals mixed with a clean place and quick service.  I'm not saying the food is 5 stars by any means, but the price makes the place worth it.  If I want food for around $5 in plaza midwood its here or HoHo cherry house(my cheap Chinese place).  The $2.99 breakfast special is a great deal, but for a only a dollar or 2 more you can add some extras.  At $3.99 you get 2 eggs, toast or biscuit, hash browns or grits, and your choice of meat.  They bring it out to you, but there isn't waiter service, so no tip is necessary.  FOR REALS $4 out the door with a stuffed belly.  Way better than Waffle house.  I found myself taking advantage of this special quite a bit lately.  The lunch menu is diverse.  Plenty of affordable options.  The gyro has become one of my favorites.  The fried fish ain't bad either.  I'm new to the area and will be in dukedom over there soon enough.  I'll be sure to keep all updated once I delve into the menu more thoroughly.  FYI:  They close at 3pm and you are sure to find FOX news on pretty much any time you go in there.

93qieCdYByZTZY6kAWCaEQ.text: The food was tasty and the people were nice but they serve everything on styrofoam and use all plastic utensils. It's not that hard for a diner to buy a damn dishwasher.  I'm not the biggest tree hugger out there but eating here made me feel ick.   I'd gladly pay an extra dollar to get a glass (reusable) plate.

r-wn69nG8AObXafHHht9NQ.text: Environmentalist be warned; you'll hate this place on principle. They use styrofoam plates & cups & disposable cutlery.   Luckily for me, I don't give a shit. The place is what to be expected when you enter, very umm homey. Its clear there are a good deal of regulars here, as the staff seem to know them quite well.   We went around lunchtime so I opted for a sandwich, instead of breakfast. I ordered the tuna melt w/ green beans (I love green beans). The green beans clearly came from a can, & were incredibly salt..which was actually fine by me, but some people may not care for that. The tuna melt itself was very flavorful. My only complaint with it would be that it could've been a bit hotter.   I would really like to try their breakfast, as that seems to be what they're known for.

u4DI3ic8sc_rcS2l0Qh9iw.text: I love that places like Sammy's still exist in America, but I will rarely eat here due to their use of styrofoam and plastic utensils. Too bad.

v5FGjbfLvSpb3AhxTcpZoQ.text: I think many of the other reviews about this place are spot on. Go in knowing what to expect and you won't be disappointed.   We were looking for a quick breakfast spot this morning after trying to go to a popular place up the street only to find that it would be a 45 min wait. Today was the kind of day where I just wanted to say, "ain't nobody got time for that" and be on my way. So back to the car we went when it hit me. What about that Sammy's place we always drive by.   So we found ourselves at Sammy's. I was happy to see the reasonable prices and we placed our order and headed to one of the booths. -1 star right now for having a high chair with broken straps.      All of the workers we came in contact with were super friendly and the good was exactly what you would expect from a place like this. Nothing bad- but also nothing spectacular I'm going to be raving about it to my out of town friends.   This seemed like a real locals type of spot and even though we enjoyed food well enough (especially the price tag!) I'm not sure it would be enough to make it into our regular rotation.

r-e2gUhSO0rQiq8xUZ7dJg.text: Nothing special a good place to grab a bite to eat very pleasant staff

_C2tocFZtrjbSEtsv1kMyQ.text: Sammy's is one of those Plaza Midwood spots that I've always driven by but just never stopped for. And I'm not quite sure why...? Maybe it's the old school-bare bones-flat-top grill wasteland I thought it would be. But really, Sammy's is a pretty solid stop.   For an array of sandwiches, super affordable breakfast platters and a damn tasty gyro, Sammy's is sweet. I strolled in on a pleasant Friday afternoon and took in the fairly diverse menu. The counter lady/order taker was quite pleasant and even offered some suggestions for me as I was a first timer. I took a seat and took a gander at the basic setup - a smattering of tables and booths, a few friendly faces and that's about it. While you will not go here for the ambiance, the man behind the grill (Sammy or a relative of his, perhaps?) commented on the gorgeous day and my pretty smile. Yes, positivity and flattery works. I liked Sammy's already.   I imagine many of the patrons I saw at Sammy's have been coming here for years. YEARS. And I fully appreciate that...have to trust a place where loyalty is important.   My gyro was pretty tasty - the meat was super tender, the pita soft and lightly toasted but the tzatziki could have used a bit more of a punch. I was not a fan, however, of the side I chose, potato salad. Sammy's make theirs with a heavy hand of yellow mustard. This would be really helpful info for those of us who don't particularly love yellow mustard laden tater salad. Nonetheless, the portions were generous - especially for the $6.50 price tag. I'll be back Sammy's and I'll tell ya - that BLT looked purty good...

photos.caption: Photo of Sammy's Deli Restaurants - Charlotte, NC, United States. Gyro pita w/potato salad

Tmuc9V7qhbi95G8Jo1dmhA.text: I've eaten breakfast here for 10 years.  I'm from around here.  Sammy's is one of the few restaurants that cooks an old fashioned breakfast that taste like your mom used to make!  Their livermush is cook the way it's supposed to be cooked!!  Crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.  Way to go guys, you remind me of my mama everytime I eat it!!

fkQaxftlzyNaECDFT4T8xA.text: My fellow employees and I usually eat here on Saturdays because its good food. Ate here today and got the same thing I always get: A double cheeseburger plate. Got the food back to the workplace and discovered I didn't have any fries. Called them and was told that a double cheeseburger didn't come with fries and that they never served it. I proceeded to tell them that I ALWAYS ordered a PLATE and ALWAYS have come with fries. More or less they told me that I needed to order somewhere else from now on. These guys just lost our business every Saturday.

DXCc_uHp88eB2pXo3xmmGg.text: Just had my coworker bring me a cheesecake from here and yeah I know I'm not expecting the best cheesecake ever from a deli. Anyways it was awful it tasted stale and like a refrigerator. I've had better cheese cake from Aldi , just saying... Anyways I just wanted a sweet dessert and got a mouthful of old nasty refrigerator tasting cheese cake :/ very disappointed

LCFn_fIJZfQVx1gQHtafJQ.text: Great spot in the AM or before 3pm. They serve delicious french toast and platters with grits and sausage.   Good wings in hot sauce or the steak sub with chs.   They have fried okra! My spot after being hungover or before work.

KCLK_7kFbkEls41osG7Cdg.text: I cannot believe I have driven by the place so many times and never stopped!   I got the friend whiting with grits and eggs. Everything was delicious but I must mention that their fried whiting was literally the most crispy and flavorful fried fish I have ever had! I will be back and I will get the fish every time!

photos.caption: Photo of Sammy's Deli Restaurants - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Sammy's Deli Restaurants - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Sammy's Deli Restaurants - Charlotte, NC, United States

1sSMJNrpg3UcXUVivORX7g.text: I've never had a disappointing experience here! Food is so good! & most importantly when we leave we don't feel horrible after eating there...(The I ate to much processed fried food feeling) 1000% recommended

photos.caption: Photo of Sammy's Deli Restaurants - Charlotte, NC, United States

25JcGkb6-1QUdshV46gopw.text: Not a fan. Sammy's is small not many seats. I called in my order but it was not ready when I went there. Which is fine... I don't mind waiting on fresh food... but that was not the case. My okra was fried twice.... ( see photos) what some places will do when they have old and cold food they will put it back in the grease to make it hot!! Making it hot THAT DOES NOT MEAN ITS FRESH. Trust me I LOVE OKRA AND I KNOW WHAT FRESH COOKED OKRA TASTE LIKE. I also had the fish meal. The fried fish was good and so was the grill fish. The hush puppies must not have been cooked at the right temp because the outside was overly cooked but the inside was doughy( see photos). IF I was to go there again I would have tell I would like fresh food lol

photos.caption: Photo of Sammy's Deli Restaurants - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried twice okra ‍(see my review on what twice fried mean.. and it&#39;s not a good thing
Photo of Sammy's Deli Restaurants - Charlotte, NC, United States. Uncooked hush puppies

_sJdyMI0WDzxHwYzK-pWIg.text: This unique spot is a hidden gem in Plaza Midwood. There was constant traffic. Regulars enjoying their moderately priced breakfast. On top of great prices, they serve breakfast and lunch all day. The grits were creamy and cooked to perfection. And the fried flounder was soooooo crispy and well cooked.

photos.caption: Photo of Sammy's Deli Restaurants - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried Flounder, super crispy!
Photo of Sammy's Deli Restaurants - Charlotte, NC, United States. 1 egg, cheddar cheese grits and bacon...great price.

363eXgQGlzgVRZVfJcN9bg.text: Well, it's needs to be pointed out. 4 stars for breakfast. BUT. All the dishware is disposable. You eat on paper, with plastic utensils, and drink your coffee from styrofoam. And then it all gets tossed in the trash to end up in the landfill or OCEAN. GET A DISHWASHER and real dishwares. We now live in the age of responsibility, the planet is suffering and it has to stop.

LffmRO_GhPcxcWXHpVljNg.text: Sammy's Deli is a great, rare place in Plaza Midwood. It's so hard to find simple, small town cookin and they achieved it so well. They food is very filling, they have a huge menu and you don't have to dress up fancy to eat here. It's like a classic deli style restaurant that serves amazing breakfast, lunch and dinner!

6DlLXR73n7Ea8ThyszvdXw.text: I stopped in at Sammy's to continue my reuben adventure around Charlotte, and I found (for not the first time) if you order two of the same thing, there's no guarantee both people will get the same thing. One reuben was pretty good all-around, while the second reuben had bread with a weirdly chewy texture that significantly altered the sandwich (maybe the bread was old?). The corned beef and kraut were pretty good, but the cheese was almost non-existent as was the russian. The bread had good flavor, but again the second sandwich was almost hard to eat at times (we switched just so I understood - she wasn't lying about the bread).  If you get lucky and get the good serving you'll be happy with a flavorful reuben for a reasonable price. If you get the other one, you'll very much regret your order. Good luck!

photos.caption: Photo of Sammy's Deli Restaurants - Charlotte, NC, United States. Reuben at Sammy&#39;s Deli

oIMw5RejsVGZnZmnPgiPSQ.text: A solid 3 stars, with even potential for a 4th if I can get my own order right before going there HA.  Finally tried out after driving by for over a year.  I had 3 egg whites, 3 pieces of bacon, and hashbrowns and a side of pickles.  The boy had sausage gravy biscuits.  The eggs were cooked perfectly, but next time I must remember to order the bacon and hashbrowns extra crispy....other than that, I'd be happy.  Oh, also -1 star because there isn't even a fruit offering. Some sort of banana/apple/berry blend would be fine!

5rMfzHetVjFoCKK6Tc2vUA.text: Don't order the biscuits and gravy. It resembles nothing even half decent. The gravy tastes and looks like flour mixed with water (NO SEASONING of any kind) and tiny random pieces of chopped sausage patty. Wtf. 2 stars instead of 1 because the lady cashier and server were very kind.

j11eAr0YrV3wR00tBFKd8Q.text: I'll amp Sammy's up to 3 stars principally due to good service and hot food prepared quickly.  I'm principally a breakfast eater for adventures outside my kitchen, and I was surprised at the freshness of the fried fish, the nice crisp on the hashbrowns, and the eggs cooked to order--nicely done over-easy.  But, it was freezing inside, the coffee one-click above 7/11, and styrofoam plates, and plastic forks--yuck.  Nothing takes the warmth out of breakfast like molded polystyrene.  No thanks.  Service, however, as others mentioned was very good.

9DKRvcsBP7nNhhjKgZWRig.text: What can I say.... hmmmmm. Nothing but great tasting food. I have probably eaten this food over 20 times in over a year but today was my first time sitting down and enjoying this authentic spot for great breakfast and lunch. The staff is uber friendly. Smiles and laughs for days. Needless to say no more take out for me...this food is to be enjoyed sitting down amongst good folk and friendly faces!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sammy's Deli Restaurants - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pork Chop Deluxe Meal (2 of them)

XgQxQBOTDUz3ZuwtzzJLBQ.text: Had a craving for hotdogs and i should have followed my instinct and went to the fast food chain "COOK OUT".I spent $7 on 2 of the grosses hotdogs I've ever tasted.The rest of the food is ok but if you try this place do not order the watery hotdogs!

24Sq4SVwaQ66XxZhMgEBzw.text: The food is nothing fancy, but it is well prepared and there are lots of options.  Great prices/value

h8JnU0ji-1pGbJVEtXyE0g.text: We love Sammy's for breakfast! It is inexpensive but good food. They have breakfast specials all day. I always do the $5 plate: 2 scrambled eggs, bacon, hash browns, and toast! The staff is friendly and efficient.

Na8o681cp_0IwO5n8O5ivA.text: I love the steak sub, it's so good. Prices are reasonable, staff is nice. They serve the whole menu all day, the only downside is they are only open til 3pm.

5mQm5UjhUpbk1O6mIscQgw.text: I have a friend who RAVED about this place.   First let me say the customer service is phenomenal. There's ample seating, 2 flatscreen TV's for viewing pleasure and you can order whatever is on the menu at any time.   I ordered the chicken philly and fried squash.   They have themselves another customer. I'm thoroughly satisfied.

eJx4gHUeLpzDAf7PhOZUag.text: We love this place for Sunday breakfast. It has a great neighborhood feel. The food is classic simple eats, served on disposable plates. The grits are delicious. I like getting the classic breakfast and my boyfriend often gets the sandwiches.  Family-run place that reminds me of all the places I grew up going to in New Jersey, Delaware, Pennsylvania and Maryland. The staff is extremely friendly and always have smiles on their faces.  As long as your expectations are for a no-frills blue collar joint, this place will never disappoint.

photos.caption: Photo of Sammy's Deli Restaurants - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ordering area

jukiikfUpol7hekMwbLbag.text: Nice grilled chicken salad. The portion size is so big I divided into two meals. Breakfast is good too

ODoL9BSWMGjZ1KcT1Qzn6w.text: Hole in wall dinner. The menu is extensive, sandwiches,  seafood platters, veggie plates, hamburgers to name a few. Most plates come with a side and are prices in the $7-8 range. Food is ordered at the front, cooked to serve and comes up fast. It  is brought to you by the staff, who are marginal at best. The inside definitely has that hole in the wall feel meaning if looks dirty because nothing has been updated in years, the seats of chairs and booths are stained and have tears from age. But overall food is a B+ and there is something for everyone
